vinted-securite-photo-guide.title: Vinted: The ultimate guide to securing your photos
vinted-securite-photo-guide.desc: Why and how to clean your images before selling.
vinted-securite-photo-guide.content:
You just posted an ad on Vinted. The photo is clear, the item well described, the price attractive. But did you know that this simple photo could reveal your exact address to any stranger? This is not science fiction. It's a technical reality that most sellers ignore ‚Äî and that some malicious buyers are already exploiting.

In this guide, we explain concretely where this risk comes from, why it concerns you if you sell on Vinted, Leboncoin or eBay, and above all how to protect yourself in seconds.

Security_Alert_042

[CRITICAL_THREAT] The Invisible Danger

When you take a photo with your smartphone, the device doesn't just capture the image. It automatically records dozens of technical information called EXIF data (Exchangeable Image File Format). Among them:

  • > GPS_COORDINATES
  • > TIMESTAMP_DATA
  • > HARDWARE_MODEL
  • > OWNER_TAGS

This metadata is invisible in your gallery, but anyone can extract it with a simple free tool.

Seller Impact Analysis

Imagine: you photograph an item in your living room. A malicious buyer downloads your photo, extracts the GPS coordinates, and obtains your address on Google Maps. He now knows where you live, when you posted, and what time you're home.

This scenario is not hypothetical. Cases of burglary, theft, and stalking have already been documented. Vinted security passes through your vigilance.

[MODULE] How to Sell Securely

Brute Capture

Photograph your items as usual. Don't change anything to your habits.

Step_02

Step_03

Secure Upload

Publish with complete serenity on Vinted, Leboncoin or eBay. Your data stays with you.

Why GhostMeta?

  • ‚úì

supprimer-exif-iphone-android.title: Remove EXIF on iPhone and Android
supprimer-exif-iphone-android.content:
[SYSTEM_COMMAND] THREAT_REPORT ‚Äî GPS POST-MORTEM PERSISTENCE

EXIF / XMP / IPTC

EXIF metadata isn't limited to raw GPS. On Android/iOS, XMP dictionaries and OffsetTime fields survive superficial deletions. 30% of GPS tags can be recovered via forensics. The threat: spatio-temporal cross-referencing via EXIF-ITUP dictionaries.

// FORENSICS RESIDUE (REAL CASE)

> GPSLatitudeRef: 48¬∞51'23.4"N
GPSLongitudeRef: 2¬∞17'42.1"E
MakerNote (Apple): 12 unerased chunks

[SYSTEM_COMMAND] MOBILE_OS_LIMITS ‚Äî THE NATIVE DECEPTION

Apple 'Hide Location': only removes main tags. But keeps: GPSImgDirection, GPSTimeStamp, and XMP:GPSAltitude.

Google Photos 'Remove Locations': cloud operation. The local file keeps APP1 and APP13 markers.

Native iOS Command

/usr/bin/ImageIO -removeProperty kCGImagePropertyGPS

‚ö†Ô∏è Ignores XMP, JFIF, TIFF-EP.

Systematic Residue

EXIF:OffsetTimeOriginal + XMP:CreateDate

Location to ¬±200km via timezone.

DANGER: JSON sidecar

Google Photos creates associated .json files containing precise GPS coordinates. Location removal doesn't erase these sidecars.

[SYSTEM_COMMAND] GHOSTMETA_SUPERIORITY ‚Äî TOTAL NEUTRALIZATION

GhostMeta operates by canvas pixel reconstruction ‚Äî residual data in thumbnails and non-standard fields are overwritten with pseudo-random AES-256-CTR fill. Forensics tools (exiftool) only find null blocks.

comprendre-donnees-exif-gps.title: Understanding EXIF and GPS Data
comprendre-donnees-exif-gps.desc: Everything you need to know about hidden metadata.
comprendre-donnees-exif-gps.content:
[DATA_SHEET] EXIF: The Invisible Archive

Created in 1995, the Exchangeable Image File Format is a standard for attaching metadata to images. What was useful for professional photographers became a privacy nightmare with GPS smartphones.

THREAT_LEVEL: CRITICAL

Most Sensitive Tags

  • >
    GPS Altitude/Latitude: Your precise location (within 3 meters).
  • >
    DateTimeOriginal: The exact time revealing your routines.
  • >
    Make/Model: Your equipment value, a potential theft target.
  • >
    Software: The editing app, exploitable for attacks.

How It's Exploited

A photo posted on social networks contains enough data to locate your home, determine your schedules, and evaluate your possessions. Attackers use automated tools to extract this data at scale.

The EXIF Reader

Online tools like Jeffrey's Image Metadata Viewer display all metadata in seconds. No technical expertise required.

Batch Extraction

Scripts can process thousands of images to create movement maps and identify high-value targets.

The GhostMeta Solution

GhostMeta doesn't just delete tags ‚Äî it rebuilds the image pixel by pixel. No metadata can survive this reconstruction. Your photos become truly anonymous.

nettoyage-photo-local-vs-cloud.title: Photo Cleaning: Local vs Cloud
nettoyage-photo-local-vs-cloud.content:
[SECURITY_AUDIT] The Cloud Anonymity Paradox

Sending a photo to a server to "anonymize" it is like revealing your identity to the guard before asking him to mask your face. Every shot transits, is copied to disks, analyzed by proprietary algorithms. Anonymity becomes fiction as soon as you lose control of the flow.

‚òÅÔ∏è CLOUD_MINING guaranteed leak

  • Data capture ‚Äî Upload to third-party servers whose location you don't know.
  • Temporary storage ‚Äî Persistent fragments on disks or CDN caches for up to 90 days.
  • Traceability ‚Äî IP, timestamp and browser fingerprint are systematically logged.

üõ°Ô∏è LOCAL_BUNKER sovereignty

  • GhostMeta ‚Äî 100% local execution, no pixel leaves your machine.
  • Canvas API ‚Äî Processing via local hardware acceleration without network transfer.
  • Zero transfer ‚Äî No telemetry, no API key, pure static analysis.

Auditor's Conclusion

Digital sovereignty begins with local code execution. As long as you outsource the processing of your sensitive data, you depend on the goodwill of actors whose business model relies on exploiting that data.

ghostmeta-manifeste-confidentialite.title: GhostMeta: Privacy Manifesto
ghostmeta-manifeste-confidentialite.content:
GHOSTMETA MANIFESTO

Digital Sovereignty Protocol v1.0 // Status: ACTIVE

The Programmed Erosion of Anonymity

We are in 2026. The Internet is an open-air data market. Metadata is a social engineering weapon. Latitude, longitude, timestamp: this data forms a targeting grid. Not cleaning it is like painting a target on your back.

SYS_LOG: NO_TRACKING

Why Free Doesn't Mean Resale

GhostMeta rejects the 'You are the Product' model. Privacy is the architectural foundation of our code. We refuse tracking on principle.

The Radical Local-Only Choice

The Cloud is someone else's computer. GhostMeta transforms your browser into a bunker via WebAssembly. 100% of processing happens on your CPU. No data leaves your machine. It's the only mathematical guarantee of privacy.

Tank Aesthetic

Our interface is cold and industrial. GhostMeta is a digital machine tool. Data protection is a conflict, not a game.

The Right to Obscurity

Anonymity is the precondition of freedom. Disappearing from algorithmic radars is the ultimate privilege we make accessible.

Zero Compromise, Zero Logs

  • Zero third-party cookies.
  • Zero server storage (Stateless).
  • Zero user telemetry.
"Sovereignty is not delegated. It is executed."
